candidates.title: Add upper limit to rust client
Clean up Solana state by minimizing account space for TM.
Patch 1.13.3 publish ideas
candidates.body:
### Build
* cargo release --dry-run works.
* Program builds with Solana-CLI 1.17.34 and 1.18.15.

### Changes
* Updated to Solana 1.17
* Updated Auth rules.
* Updated Borsh and had to implement the Borsh 10 trait method.
* Removed rooster so tests won't build.

candidates.title: First pass for reducing compute using create_program_address when pos…
Downgrade mpl-utils dependency
candidates.body: This PR downgrades `mpl-utils` version from the `0.3.x` to `0.2.x`, since Token Metadata `1.13.x` does not depend on `spl-token-2022`.

candidates.title: Update Kinobi version for Rust client
candidates.body:
This PR bumps Kinobi version to `0.15`, which includes new features for the Rust client:
- Add a `serde` feature
- Change mod visibility to avoid ambiguity when importing types
- Add bytes helper to account types
- Add doc to default accounts

candidates.title: Remove unused submodules
candidates.body: There seems to be some "leftovers" from the submodules config, this PR removes them.

candidates.title: Update kinobi version
candidates.body: PR that updates the Kinobi version, which simplifies the dependencies for the generated Rust client.

candidates.title: Add rust client sdk
candidates.body: This PR adds a Rust client SDK with minimal dependency requirements. More details of how to use the SDK are presented on the `README.md` file.

candidates.title: Add Solana version range
candidates.body: This PR adds Solana `1.16` compatibility for Token Metadata. As a result, Solana dependencies are expressed with a version range `>= 1.14.13, < 1.17`.

candidates.title: Add Token-2022 support
candidates.body:
PR to add support to Token-2022 accounts in the unified handlers. The changes consist of:
- using `StateWithExtensions` to unpack SPL Token `Account` and `Mint`
- all SPL Token instructions used are from `spl-token-2022`, which support both SPL Token versions
- use of `test_case` on bpf tests so tests run using both SPL Token versions

All unified instructions are updated:

 - [x] Burn
 - [x] Create
 - [x] Delegate
 - [x] Lock
 - [x] Mint
 - [x] Print
 - [x] Revoke
 - [x] Transfer
 - [x] Unlock
 - [x] Unverify
 - [x] Update
 - [x] Verify

These now can be used with both SPL Token programs.

The changes depend on the following PRs:
- mpl-utils: https://github.com/metaplex-foundation/metaplex-program-library/pull/1151
- rooster (for bpf tests): https://github.com/metaplex-foundation/rooster/pull/7

Additionally, validation of mint and token accounts extensions were added to the `Create`, `Mint`, `Print` and `Transfer` instructions.

Co-authored-by: Jon Cinque <me@jonc.dev> (@joncinque)

chosen_pr.title: Patch 1.13.3 publish ideas

### Changes

* Removed rooster so tests won't build.
